15:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <vmassol> mflorea: I think there's a "bug" in the Include macro; we shouldn't be using a displayer to perform the include when context != new IMO  
15:30 <+mflorea> vmassol: the displayer has a special param that tells it not to render the content. It was added for this use case.  
15:30 <vmassol> I know but it's bad  
15:30 <vmassol> the include macro should never use the displayer for context = current  
15:30 <vmassol> it draws an unnecesary dependency and is semantically the opposite to what we want  
15:31 <+tmortagne> mflorea: what do you mean by not render ?  
15:32 <+tmortagne> no transformation is applied ?  
15:32 <+tmortagne> i.e. it does nothing ?  
15:41 <+mflorea> vmassol, tmortagne: yes by "not render" I meant not run the transformations, but that doesn't mean the displayer does nothing. It still handles the IS\_IN\_RENDERING\_ENGINE flag, the translated content and the section retrieval.  
15:42 <+tmortagne> ok then all that should maybe be separated in two since we call a displayer while we don't display anything  
15:42 <+mflorea> re "unnecesary dependency", I don't understand. You would still need the displayer for context=new, so how can you get rid of this dependency?  
15:42 <vmassol> mflorea: dependency when context = current  
15:43 <vmassol> it's the same thing as thomas just said  
15:43 <+mflorea> I though you meant maven dependency  
15:44 <+mflorea> well, otherwise we need to move the part that is still done by the displayer when context=current in some commons place/API  
15:46 <+tmortagne> yep would be cleaner (not a priority but a todo or an issue would be nice)  
15:46 <+mflorea> that is: handling the IS\_IN\_RENDERING\_ENGINE flag, getting the translated content and retrieving the specified section  
15:49 <+mflorea> guys, what do we do about the release? postpone it a few days or proceed with the current state?  
15:53 <qwebirc35277> has joined #xwiki  
15:53 <qwebirc35277> I guys  
16:02 <qwebirc35277> has quit  
16:04 <CIA-122> Jean-Vincent Drean feature-extensiondistribution \* r8d49b82 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8d49b829a6520f39e2401ad634a76f80711e40b4 / (7 files): XWIKI-5195 : Make possible to implement any component from the wiki, using objects - http://git.io/dpvb3w  
16:04 <CIA-122> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* rf253795 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f2537956e79aac79dc42bbbf52ea4574ddc070ff / (7 files): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform into feature-extensiondistribution - http://git.io/QOekKg  
16:05 <vmassol> mflorea: re release, 2 options  
16:05 <vmassol> introduce a 1 to 2 weeks M4 and do a short RC just after then final (ie keep same final date)  
16:05 <vmassol> or  
16:06 <vmassol> adjust M3 by 1 week and reduce RC by one week  
16:06 <vmassol> I think I prefer this last option  
16:06 <vmassol> one release less to do and we need max dev time  
16:06 <vmassol> let me get the dates  
16:07 <vmassol> 4.2M3: 3 sep  
16:07 <vmassol> 4.2RC1: 10 sep  
16:07 <vmassol> 4.2 final: 17 sep  
16:07 <vmassol> wdyt?  
16:07 <+tmortagne> +1 for no M4 and delay M3  
16:08 <+mflorea> +1 for delaying M3  
16:09 <vmassol> mflorea: can you send the vote email?  
16:09 <+mflorea> yes  
16:10 <vmassol> cool  
16:15 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
16:16 <tillo> Hello/Salut. I need some help with an apparent bug I found on XWikiAuthServiceImpl. Anyone around before I open a ticket?  
16:17 <vmassol> tillo: hi there, you're the one who sent the mail on the list right?  
16:17 <vmassol> I didn't answer because that's not really my domain, so I don't know...  
16:17 <tillo> Uhm, nope, not me, at least not that I can remember.  
16:17 <vmassol> someone named Bob Egolf  
16:18 <vmassol> ok it's a different topic then  
16:18 <tillo> Well, mine is about a missing XWikiUsers object.  
16:20 <tillo> The code does context.getWiki().getDocument(username, context) then doc.getObject("XWiki.XWikiUsers"), and the result is : "DEBUG x.x.u.i.x.XWikiAuth  
16:20 <tillo> ServiceImpl - [Kyos] XWikiUsers object for user XWiki.1008 not found within the following document : xwiki:XWiki.1008" <-- it gives that only after visiting the users administration page, and afterwards it remains broken.  
16:21 <tillo> It's important to note that it only happens for one user, and not for another (identical) one. And it only happens within a subwiki (not workspace).  
16:22 <tillo> We are using 4.2M2 and Basic Auth (it really is SSL client auth, but XWiki thinks it's Basic Auth)  
16:22 <tillo> I can easily do a "return true" within checkPassword(), since we don't use them, but I'd like to know what's going on and if there is anything else which is broken.  
16:48 <CIA-122> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-extensiondistribution \* r83190fc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/83190fc5db7c4deba2aea2c72b052545252b8619 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/pom.xml : Add distribution module in parent pom. - http://git.io/7PI-cA

17:52 <tillo> If someone is looking for a challenge, here is one: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8160  
17:57 <vmassol> tillo: thanks :)  
17:57 <vmassol> (and sorry nobody answered to you today...)  
17:59 <tillo> Thank you for listening! And, by the way, I heard there is professional support... how can I proceed? :)  
18:01 <vmassol> tillo: see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support#HProfessionalSupport

19:45 <tmortagne> has quit  
20:12 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I can't find a way to use inside a wiki page Velocity macros defined in a Velocity template. With #template('something.vm') the template is evaluated but the macros are not available (I suspect they are register in a different namespace, e.g. the 'something.vm' namespace, and thus are not visible from the Space.MyPage namespace).  
20:13 <+mflorea> obviously, I don't want to use macros.vm  
20:13 <vmassol> has quit  
20:14 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Yes, that's right, there's an issue about that IIRC  
20:15 <+mflorea> :(  
20:16 <@sdumitriu> Ah, not quite the same, but I think it's the same root cause: https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-3979  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> No idea how to solve it, other than "don't define them in the template"  
20:18 <+mflorea> in my case I need the extension macros because I have to display extension UI when there's no page in the wiki  
20:18 <+mflorea> ofc, the quick solution is to put the macros in macros.vm, but I don't like it..
